"I wonder if this girl will like my new invention..." wonders Brad. Well what does Brad decide to do?

- oh by the way, Brad is wondering right now if he should tell this new girl about his crazy adventure of being 1 inch tall one year ago...

1111.content:
"Here it is--my shrink ray!"

Cherry closely observes it, fascinated. "Wow. So this thing can make a person really tiny? That is so cool."

"Yeah, do you want a demonstration?"
1111.title: Showing off the machine

choices: Hang out there for a bit and chat.
11111.content:
"Here," you say, as you ready the machine. "I'm going to shrink myself down to about an inch tall."

"Are you sure? Will you be okay?"

"Oh, yeah, of course. After all, I'll have a big you around in case there are any problems. And look, when it's time to grow me back, just press this button here. Now to shrink me, you press that one."

"Okay," Cherry says, as you step into position.

"I'm ready when you are."

Cherry presses the button, and a beam of light strikes you. Gradually, Cherry--as well as everything else--gets bigger and bigger. Cherry stares at you, awestruck, as you dwindle down to a single inch in height.

You wave up to her, as she carefully approaches you. "Wow, you're so...You're so tiny." She bends down a bit to get a better look. When that doesn't prove nearly helpful enough, she gets down on her knees and crouches down. "You are so adorable right now."

"And you would not believe how huge you are right now. I have to admit, you're a little intimidating at this size."

"Oh, don't be scared of little ol' me. I don't bite. So what do you want to do now?"
11111.title: Shrinking before Cherry

111112.content: "Well," you say, "It might be fun to explore the giant world a bit. So how about we go to..."
111112.title: Where To?

1111122.content:
Maybe out of the house would be a good start for you after the shrinking wears off. But you know for a fact you cannot trek to the mall by yourself. It will take at least a month, maybe more before you reach the mall's main entrance. So, someone's going to have to give you a lift to the mall, without noticing of course.

Your choices are little, but then again, there is a 3rd option too.

1st choice is obviously Cindy, because she goes to the mall almost everyday and her room is not far from yours.

2nd choice is your mom. However, your mom doesn't go to different shops. She sticks to one shop, then leaves.

Now the 3rd choice is the long walk without anyone giving you a lift, so let's just throw that one out.

Who will you go to the mall with?
1111122.title: Who to go with to the Mall?

choices: The machine fires and hit one of you.
11112.content:
"Well..." Cherry said, "I do, but...I don't...well...I mean..."

You easily catch on to what she's saying. "You don't want anyone getting hurt." Cherry nodded. "Well, all I have is this apple. Eh, better it than us." You place the apple on a stool in front of the shrinking ray and activate the shrinking ray. It rumbles and whirs mechanically as you input the directions for shrinking. As you are working, Cherry sidles next to you looking over your shoulder. "So, how did you get so good with computers like that?"

"I sorta taught myself. I had a little help, too."

"That's kinda cool."

The machine started up and the ray was glowing a bright blue. It was whirring faster and clanking louder. Cherry was starting to hide behind you. You kinda liked it. The ray fired a blue ray that hit the apple. The two of you watched as the apple shrunk to the size of a marble. Cherry's eyes widened as she saw the tiny apple. "Oh my God! It shrunk! I can't believe it shrunk!" You nod proud of yourself. She'll ask you out before the day is done. Cherry is looking at the apple. She slowly touches it. She picks it up delicately and nibbles on it. She looks at you as if you were Willy Wonka and yells excitedly. "It tastes like a normal apple, but it tastes juicier!"

"That's because... well, I'm not sure how it works."

"How come the government hasn't found out about this?"

"Well, I didn't want to. You don't want to know what would happen to people suddenly knew about this. People would be shrinking other people left and right. It would be chaos." Cherry looked spooked by the thought. "You aren't the kind of person who would harm someone smaller or weaker than you, are you?"

Cherry shook her head. "No, I'm not."

You smile, "Good, I know I can trust you now." You say as you put your arm around her shoulder. Cherry was about to say something when she noticed that the shrinking machine was whirring wildly and shaking violently. "Is that supposed to be doing that?"

You look over at the malfunctioning shrinking machine. It definitely isn't supposed to be doing that. "This doesn't normally happen. What's going on?"
11112.title: Cherry's Excitement

You look up and see a huge shadow above you. You look up and see a gigantic Cherry. "That was a close one, I think I'm still the same size, Brad. Brad?" You look around and see that you've been shrunk. Cherry gets down on her hands and knees and looks for you. You run as fast as you can around her to her face and yell, "Cherry! Down here!"

Cherry's eyes get huge when she sees you. "Brad? Is that you?" She picks you up and puts you on the palm of her hand. "You're tiny!"

"Yeah, but don't get too worried, I've been through this before."

"Wait, so it happened before?" You didn't want to make her angry. Even if you barely know her. "You knew this might happen and you decided to show me anyway?" she yelled.

You covered your ears in pain. "I didn't think that it would go like that. I thought I worked out everything."

"Yeah, obviously not!"

"Just carry me to the machine so I can unshrink myself." Cherry walks over to the machine and you hop off to see that it's completly busted. Some parts can be fixed, but some parts have to be completly replaced. You motion Cherry to pick you up again.

"Well, I've got bad news. I can't unshrink myself."

"The machine is broken. I'll need some replacement parts."

"How long do you think it will take you to fix it?"

You think for a while. "Well, to get all the parts I need, it may take a couple days. Who knows how long it'll take me to fix it at this size?"

"Maybe I could help you. I could take you everywhere you need to go, just tell me where to go and I'll get those parts you need."

"Why?" you ask, uncertain of her motives.

She replies, "Oh, I'm sorry. I thought you'd like my company."

"I do, I do like your company, but I'm just curious. Why do you want to help me?"

Cherry's tone becomes a bit more flirty and says, "Because, maybe when this is all over, we could go out sometime. Besides, it's a great way to see the town!"

Score! This is the best mistake you've ever made! "Okay, that's great! Let's go!" Cherry smiles and asks,
1111211.title: Not again!

choices: Assure her you'll pay her back.
11112111.content:
“First, we need to go to Best Buy,” you tell the giant beauty as you stand in the palm of her hand, which is kind of weird, but it is a unique experience, and you only live once.

“Okay. Not what I was expecting...Thought there’d be some little store for inventors no one ever heard of or something like that.”

“Nope. I just need to get a laptop computer and pull out some of the circuitry. Oh, and then we’d have to stop at Target...”

“A laptop? This is going to set you back a bit.”

“How cheap do you expect a shrinking machine to be?”

She chuckles. “Good point, and I guess it’s hard to put a price tag on your size.”

“Yeah, just count yourself lucky you weren’t the one who got zapped.”

She turns her head around, looking for something. “Where’s your wallet?”

“My wallet?”

“Yeah, I can’t afford a laptop right now.”

You feel it in your pocket. Your wallet is on your person, and it shrunk with you. Your credit cards, cash, it’s all useless.

Well, the credit cards might be good for an online transaction, but if you have to wait for everything to get shipped, you’re looking at staying tiny at least a week or so. But that might be more time to get to know Cherry...

111122.content:
The machine begins rattling faster and faster. The entire house starts to shake. The lights flickered on and off, and then parts started flying off the machine that you didn't even know it had. It starts casting a strange green light that seems totally unfamiliar to you, the person who created it.

"What's happening?" asked Cherry in a frightened voice.

"I don't know, you say grimly, "but we should get out of here."

You and Cherry break towards the door, but a gust of wind - probably coming from the machine - slams it closed. Frantically, you try to open it, but to no avail - it's jammed.

Suddenly, the green glow behind you turns into a flash. Then the world goes white, then it goes black. Pain courses through your body - more pain than you've ever experienced in your life. A shard of metal embeds itself in your palm. It feels strange, almost like it's alive. Then something hits you on the head and you black out.

When you come to, you feel a terrible throbbing in your head. You look around but to no avail - all you see is blackness. For a second you think you're still unconscious, but then you hear sobbing coming from somewhere near you. It's Cherry.

"What is it?" you ask, dreading the answer. She says nothing, but continues sobbing.

You claw around in the darkness and find a large blade. Feeling about, you find a weak spot in the wall and attack it with the blade. It gives a little. After repeated slashing, it breaks down, and what you see is worse than you imagined.

The room is gigantic - far bigger than it usually is. Turning around, you see that the shrinking machine had fallen on top of you, and the "blade" you used to get out was actually the shard of metal that had been embedded in your hand. Next to it is what you feared you would see - Cherry, shrunk to the same size you must have been, on her knees, crying at her fate. The machine was totaled.

"You're alive!" she exclaims and throws her arms around you as if greeting an old friend one had not seen for a long time.

"Of course I am," you say, dusting yourself off. "It's a shrink ray, not a death ray."

"But it collapsed on top of you!" she said. "It should have crushed you!"

"I thought there was a cavity," you say, "but now that you mention it, that wouldn't make sense. But that's all beside the point. The real question is, what do we do now?"

"I don't know," Cherry says. "I've never actually been shrunk before. You have - you tell us what to do."

She was right, of course, but for some reason you couldn't remember a thing about it right now. It must be the concussion from when the machine hit you - or shock.

Of course, you're not about to let her know that you were as clueless as she was - she needed to see you strong. It was the only way you would have a chance of staying motivated enough to find a solution. Falter, and you would give up, and then you would have no chance.

"Right," you say. "We need to ...
111122.title: The Ultimate Malfunction

1111222.content:
"We need to get someone's attention," you say, "because otherwise we don't stand a chance."

"Won't that be hard?" she asked. "Or dangerous?"

"Yes," you say. "If you were two inches tall, you could just shout, but at one inch it's much harder. Something to do with science."

"Ah," she says. "Where did you learn that?"

"Hey," you say, "when a guy gets randomly shrunk, he's bound to be curious."

The door is still jammed, but that doesn't matter - you and Cherry slip out underneath. You hear noises in the kitchen, so that's where you go. On the way, however, you make the somewhat mortifying discovery that you are not one inch tall but, in fact, half an inch. When you tell, Cherry, however, she merely shrugs. You think this is due to a bug in the machine, but something doesn't quite seem right about that theory. Something seems amiss - but you dismiss the thought.

You enter the kitchen and see that your mother is preparing sandwiches for a mid-afternoon snack. You must have been unconscious longer than you though. Gesturing for Cherry to follow, you walk over to your mother and call up. She doesn't respond.

You realize that you have two feasible options at this point - either climb up your mother, which could be dangerous, or go find your sister. In the past, she has been better at noticing you than your mother, but at this small size, she might think you're a bug and ... Once again, you dismiss the though.
1111222.title: ... go and talk to someone."  (Isn't th...

11112221.content:
You and Cherry have been climbing your mother for what seems like hours - but looking at the clock, it turns out to only have been five minutes. You check your position and see that you are currently on her knee. This is going to be a long climb.

After another five minutes, you are at her waist. Looking up, you see that climbing on her shirt will be next to impossible. Cherry, catcing up, notices this too, and once more asks what to do. What do you do, anyways? You consider going down, but that would take too long and not really be worth it. After all, you don't know where your sister is. You also consider hopping into her pocked and waiting until her ear is easier to reach, but that could be a long time.

Then you notice her apron. It's flailing a lot, so it won't be easy, but the material is far easier to climb than her shirt. Plus, it ties behind her neck, so it shouldn't be too hard to get to her ear from there. There's a lot of food on it, sure, but nothing's ever easy when you're smaller than you've ever been. Looking at Cherry, you see you have to make a decision for her sake.
11112221.title: A Rough Climb

111122211.content:
It's no easier than you expected, this apron-climbing business. Looking down, you see the world - or rather, your kitchen - looking both large and small, and you gulp. Looking up, you see how far you have yet to go, and you gulp again. Looking to the side, you see Cherry, as scared as you are, positively blue, and you know you have to be strong for her sake, so, gulping once more to swallow your fears, you climb on.

You're in such a zone that, by the time you reach the top, you feel as if no more than twelve seconds could have passed in the climbing, when in reality it took half an hour. Looking down, you see that Cherry has almost reached you, so you reach down and help her onto your mother's shoulder. You also see that, somehow, your mother is still making sandwiches. Wow.

After catching her breath, Cherry manages to ask, "What now?", a question which you are incredibly tired of hearing by now, even though it's only been asked three or four times in the past hour. You see that your mother's ear is higher up than you thought - she's wearing an earring, but only one of you would be able to climb up. If you go, something terrible might happen to Cherry, but if Cherry goes, something terrible might happen to you. Of course, you can't just send her up without asking, and she may take a while to answer, so if it's urgent, you have to go - but that would be selfish. Besides, if something terrible were to happen to you, you'd have a better chance of surviving, having had experience, albeit experience you can't remember.
111122211.title: Climb up her apron.

choices: Cindy (you saw Mom through her teeth)
Mom (you saw Cindy through her teeth)
1111222112.content:
"Well," you say, "only one of us can make it up Mom's earring, and if they don't do it quickly, something might happen to the other. Then again, it might not. I want you to decide which one of us will climb up her earring."

"Really? I - I think it's too much pressure."

"Hey, I can't make all the decisions. You're shrunk, too; besides, it's my fault this happened, so if something terrible did happen, it should happen to me."

"But do I have enough upper-body strength to climb up her earring? It looks scary - but so does this."

"You have to make a decision, and you have to make it fast."

"Okay, I think - "

Unfortunately, you'll have to wait until later to find out what Cherry thinks, because just then Mom suddenly turns to get a knife with which to cut the sandwiches she was making. You and Cherry fall off her shoulder and freefall through the air, spontaneously holding each other as tightly as possible. With a soft plop, you land on a sandwich, which is probably lucky, as it cushioned the fall.

As you try to get up, however, you realize you can't move, as you are stuck in the PB&J. Your mother looks at the sandwiches, realizes she forgot to close them, does so, and then you can't see anything. You feel a tug on the bread and Cherry shivering.

"I don't like this," she says.

"Me neither," you admit. "Still, this doesn't usually happen." As far as you remember.

"I'm hungry," she says.

"I know exactly what to do," you say, and scoop some peanut butter into your mouth and swallow it.

"Oh," she simply replies and does the same (you think; you can't see).

Then you feel even more darkness closing in around you and realize with horror that you are being eaten. Frantically, you and Cherry roll out, finally able to escape the sandwich due to saliva, and catch a glimpse of the outside world before being swallowed by
1111222112.title: Cherry's Indecision

choices: ...build another shrink ray first.  This is way to big to handle right now."

11112222.content:
You manage the long trek to your sister's room. Along the way, you develop a strong hatred for carpet. The door is open, so you slide in. Cindy is painting her nails. As you approach, she peers quizzically in your direction.

Finally, in what seems to be too hopeful for hope, she picks the two of you up and plops you in her hand. "Brad? And Cheri?"

"Yes!" you exclaim, while Cheri, next to you, nods, trembling.

"You're smaller than I remember."

"Yes, I am. The machine's exploded and we need to rebuild it. The blueprints are in my room, but I wouldn't go in there right now, since the machine is too. There's a digital copy on a USB behind the El Greco in the living room.

"Why are you looking at me like that? I'm a paranoid inventor now."

Cindy takes you two to the living room, where hangs a very good replica of the View of Toledo. She pulls back the painting to reveal a shiny silver hole in the wall containing a USB.

"There it is," says Cindy. "Now let's get building."

"Wait," you say. "The walls of the compartment are clean. I had specifically left them dirty when I put in the USB."

"So? What does that mean?"

"It means that someone has removed the USB, probably copied the blueprint, and wiped down the compartment to make it look like nothing happened!"

Cindy gasps in shock. "What do we do?" asks Cheri.

"I think we should...

1112222211.title: Climbing up

11122222111.content:
Brad decides to keep climbing Cherry. He shimmies around her leg so that he is now on the front of her right thigh, and then continues to climb upwards. When he gets to the end of her jeans, he reaches up and grabs onto her shirt. Gripping the soft cotton, he hoists himself up onto the shirt and presses on, up and over her breasts, until he reaches her neck.

Brad wipes his brow and catches his breath. This climbing is hard work. He's made it so far, though, already - turning back now would be pointless. With this in mind, Brad reaches a hand up and grabs some of the soft skin of Cherry's neck, lifting himself up. He climbs up her neck and up and over her chin (which takes a considerable amount of maneuvering and strength), then onto the top of her upper lip where he sits down momentarily to rest.

The breeze coming from Cherry's nostrils as she inhales and exhales cools Brad off as he sits, sweating and gasping from the exertion. After a while, he stands up again and attempts to plan out a course of action. "I still need to get her attention somehow," he thinks, looking around. "I guess I have two options. I can continue on to her ear and try to get her to hear me, or ..." Brad looks up into Cherry's nose, with its enormous nostrils looming above him. "Or I guess I could shove my arm up her nose. That'd get her attention, too." Besides the fact that such an act would be disgusting, Brad also realizes that he would run the risk of accidentally making Cherry sneeze, and that wouldn't be pretty. Still, in his exhausted state, the tired Brad is leaning towards the ladder option, which, if anything, doesn't involve any more climbing.
11122222111.title: Keep climbing anyway.

111222221112.content:
"Screw it," thought Brad. "What's the worst that could happen?" he asked himself, already knowing the answer.

He stood up on Cherry's upper lip, wobbling a little at first. Once he had achieved somewhat of a state of balance, he turned his head upward to look at Cherry's nose, which was directly above him. He watched as she breathed in and out gently, then, just as she was about to inhale again, he stuck his arm up above his head and into her right nostril. His hand met with the moist wall of her inner nose. "Gross ..." Brad exclaimed. "This should get her attention, though." He started to rub his hand on the wall of Cherry's nose, moving his fingers around to try to tickle it.

As small as Brad was, Cherry could feel the disturbance that his hand was making inside her nose. She wiggled her nose a little.

"Ah-ha!" said Brad. "So it's working!" He kept tickling the flesh of her nose with his fingers, when he noticed her nostrils flare widely. He also started to lose his balance, because Cherry's lips had opened slightly.

"Aaaahhh ... Aaa-aahhhhhh ..."

"Oh, crap ..." said Brad, who knew he had gone too far. He pulled his hand out from Cherry's huge flaring nostril and started to panic. He couldn't stay put - Cherry was about to sneeze him off her face. Moving wasn't easy, though, either - Cherry's lips kept moving as she prepared to blow.

info.brief_description: This story continues 1 inch tall and attack of the 1 inch tall kid.
info.description:
One year has passed since Brad's ordeal in 1 inch tall. He has met a girl, Cherry, who seemed to be new to the neighborhood. Brad decides to get to know Cherry by showing her his new shrinking machine. Oh by the way, Brad has changed a bit. He is nice to others.

NO SEX SCENES, NO GAY STUFF, TOILET, its been created to be clean. Chapters will be deleted if story is not followed. Rate please and ADD chapters if you read.
